There's a similar system called '[Gae](https://ko.wikipedia.org/wiki/%EA%B3%84_%28%EC%A1%B0%EC%A7%81%29)' in Korea. Commonly, the first beneficiary used to have to pay the highest interest to the remaining members and the last beneficiary used to pay nothing but earn the interests from the earlier beneficiaries. But the system becomes easily in danger if one of them fails to pay the assigned amount monthly. So Gae used to be built among the very close people like relatives or co-workers in a very stable workplace. But in Korea, in fact, it's not that much hard to loan money from the banks, nowadays it's rare to find the Gae group. But the concept is still somewhat friendly to most Koreans.
